promptStructure.title: Text-to-Video with Veo 3.1 Fast
promptStructure.quote: Misty forest at dawn, medium shot centered on a mossy rock. Camera slowly pushes forward as soft rays of light appear between the trees, 6 seconds, 16:9 at 1080p. Audio: gentle birds and wind, no dialogue.
promptStructure.description: Keep prompts tight, single-scene and sensory. Aim to A/B ideas quickly with minimal changes between variants.
steps: Subject + focal point (one idea for the whole clip)
Light and mood (daylight, neon night, warm office, etc.)
Audio (optional): ambience + short VO, or say â€œno dialogueâ€

prompts.title: Misty forest slow push
prompts.prompt: Misty forest at dawn, slow push-in toward a mossy rock as light rays cut through trees, subtle birdsong, no dialogue, 8s, 16:9 at 1080p.

prompts.title: Vertical late-night desk loop
prompts.prompt: 6s 9:16 loop of a young woman working late at a minimalist desk, city lights blurred behind her. Slow handheld drift left/right, cool blue window light plus warm desk lamp, quiet typing + city hum, no dialogue.

faqs.q: When should I use Veo 3.1 Fast instead of Veo 3.1?
faqs.a: Use Fast for exploration, social variants and internal reviews; switch to Veo 3.1 for final hero shots and paid media.

faqs.q: Does Veo 3.1 Fast support vertical videos?
faqs.a: Yes. Veo 3.1 Fast supports 16:9 and 9:16 at 720p or 1080p; choose 9:16 for mobile-first placements.

faqs.q: Can I reuse Veo 3.1 prompts in Fast?
faqs.a: Yes. Clone a Veo 3.1 render, change engine to Veo 3.1 Fast, keep framing/tone presets, and adjust length/resolution.

faqs.q: How does pricing compare to Veo 3.1?
faqs.a: Fast runs are cheaper per second (e.g., ~$0.15/s audio on, ~$0.10/s audio off) so you can try multiple variants before upgrading.

faqs.q: Can I run Veo 3.1 Fast from Europe or LATAM?
faqs.a: Yes. It uses the same MaxVideoAI wallet/workspace and licensed DeepMind routingâ€”no separate billing needed.

custom.promptIntro: Fast mode is for quick A/B tests. Keep prompts focused, single-scene, and easy to tweak.
promptPatternSteps: Subject + focal point for the whole clip
Optional audio: ambience + short VO, or specify no dialogue

custom.promptSkeletonNote: Use consistent wording across variants so you can see exactly what changes.
custom.imageIntro: Animate a single still into a quick loop or hero shot.
imageFlow: Upload a lifestyle or product photo.
Choose Image â†’ Video, duration (4/6/8 s), aspect ratio and resolution.
Prompt subtle camera and subject motion; add light audio or keep it silent.
Generate variants by changing one element at a time (camera speed, VO tone, time of day).
imageWhy: Quick hero shots for landing pages or ecommerce
Animated social posts from brand photography
Mood loops behind titles or UI elements

multishotTips: Render 2â€“4 variants in Fast with small prompt tweaks.
Promote the best to Veo 3.1 for higher fidelity and audio depth.
Stay single-scene in Fast; use other Veo tiers for multi-beat control.
strengths: Speed and price for A/B tests and explorations
Strong for ambient, mood-driven scenes and clear product shots
Audio toggle for rough mixes or silent drafts
Ideal for social formats where 4â€“8 seconds is the whole story
boundaries: Single-scene focus; not for multi-location narratives

Slightly lower detail/realism than full Veo 3.1 (trade speed for fidelity)
Tiny text or dense UI may be soft; overlay critical copy in post
custom.tipsFooter: Use Fast to explore, then escalate winning prompts to Veo 3.1 for final polish.
safetyRules: Avoid real public figures, political content, explicit material or minors.
Some generations may be blocked or adjusted per provider policies.
Outputs carry AI provenance markers (SynthID-style watermarking).

custom.promptingTitle: How to Write a Great Veo 3.1 Fast Prompt
custom.promptingIntro: Veo Fast performs best with short, concrete prompts and clear camera direction.
custom.promptingTip: Tip: duration + aspect ratio are set in the UI â€” your prompt controls subject, action, camera, lighting, style, and sound.
promptingGlobalPrinciples: Describe the subject, composition, and lighting clearly.
Use visual anchors (specific nouns > vague adjectives).
Iterate: change one thing at a time.
custom.tipsIntro: Veo Fast is most predictable when you keep the shot simple, readable, and physical.
promptingEngineWhy: Optimized for speed and volume â€” keep beats simple and short.
Clear camera language (framing + motion) improves consistency.
Use concrete visual anchors to reduce drift.

promptingTabNotes.quick: Quick = variations. Use for fast iteration.
promptingTabNotes.structured: Structured = consistency. Use when you need reliable results.
promptingTabNotes.pro: Pro = style control. Use for precise, repeatable looks.

promptingTabs.label: Quick
promptingTabs.title: Quick prompt (fast iteration)
promptingTabs.description: Use 1â€“2 sentences when you want variations.

promptingTabs.label: Structured
promptingTabs.title: Structured prompt (best for reliable results)
promptingTabs.description: Separate information so the model can follow it consistently.
promptingTabs.copy:
Subject:
[Who/what + 1 clear action or pose.]

Setting:
[Where + time of day + 2â€“3 visual anchors.]

Composition:
- Framing: [wide / medium / close-up]
- Angle: [eye-level / low / high]
- Lens feel: [e.g., 35mm natural, shallow DOF]

Lighting + palette:
[Key light + 2â€“3 palette anchors]

Style constraints:
No logos. No readable text. Clean background.

promptingTabs.label: Pro
promptingTabs.title: Pro prompt (ultra-specific "studio brief")
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you need a very specific look or continuity across shots.
promptingTabs.copy:
Project / intent:
[One-line goal for the still.]

Subject:
[Who/what + wardrobe/materials + 2â€“3 distinctive traits.]

Location / set:
[Where + time of day + weather. Add 3 visual anchors.]

Composition:
- Framing + angle
- Lens feel + depth of field
- Look: [clean digital / subtle film grain / soft bloom]

Lighting & grade:
- Key light
- Contrast
- Palette anchors (3â€“5)

Constraints:
No logos. No readable text. No overlays.
